greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal part of a(n)^(1/2) starts with n (squares excluded).
link: Paul Tek, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Paul Tek, PARI program for this sequence
program: while int(pow10*(s-int(s))) != n: k, s = k+1, sqrt(k)
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 67)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Mar 15 2021
results.author: _Patrick De Geest_, Sep 15 1998
